meanings.definition: Relating to the study of rock layers and their relationships.
meanings.sent1: The stratigraphic analysis helped scientists understand the history of the rock formations.
meanings.sent2: Geologists use stratigraphic methods to determine the age of different rock layers.
meanings.sent3: The stratigraphic puzzle was finally solved when they found the missing piece.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a stratigraphic map, with memories layered one on top of the other.
meanings.sent5: The stratigraphic diagram made the complex geological concepts easier to grasp.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the arrangement of sedimentary rocks in distinct layers.
meanings.sent1: The stratigraphic formations in the canyon displayed clear layering of sedimentary rocks.
meanings.sent2: The stratigraphic characteristics of the cliff indicated a long history of deposition.
meanings.sent3: The stratigraphic cake she baked had layers of different flavors stacked neatly.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were like stratigraphic layers, each representing a different aspect of his personality.
meanings.sent5: The stratigraphic patterns in the sandstone were a testament to the passage of time.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the branch of geology that deals with the study of rock layers and their formation.
meanings.sent1: The stratigraphic research expedition aimed to uncover the secrets hidden within the rock layers.
meanings.sent2: Stratigraphic studies provide valuable insights into the Earth's geological history.
meanings.sent3: The stratigraphic party was a hit among geology enthusiasts.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, memories were arranged in a stratigraphic order, waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The stratigraphic journey through time revealed the Earth's ancient past.
